page.title: 07NATURE RESERVES
page.content: WARNACT-The{Warwickshire Nature {Conservation Trust}own two sites within the area:{Brandon Marsh,}at 134acres, and{Ryton on Dunsmore {sandpits.}Both are areas of former quarry workings. Brandon Marsh is one of the finest {wetland}sites in Warwickshire. Many waterfowl and waterside plants are to be found here. The site also includes an area of{heath grassland}and an area of{woodland,}the "Old Hare Covert". Ryton on Dunsmore sandpits are less important as part of the site is still being worked. However it does have potential for the future, as a bird sanctuary in particular. Further information about these reserves and about the work of WARNACT can be otained from:{WARNACT, {1 NORTHGATE ST. WARWICK. CV34 4SP
